goals__remit:
WIDE + aims to achieve a feminist vision WIDE+ is committed to the enforcement of women’s rights, as part of a larger struggle for social justice and the human rights of all. A driving principle in its work is the pursuit of gender justice, in the understanding that this can only be brought about if intersecting unequal power relations are addressed. 
 
The aims of the association are achieved through the following strategic activities: 
 
-To work to create and widen spaces to network and multiply the impact of feminist activism. . 
 
-To aim to transform institutional settings, attitudes, power relations, policies and practices so that they reflect development and economic paradigms that are in line with fundamental human rights.  
 
-To act in solidarity and collaborate with feminist and women’s and human rights movements, groups and individuals.
relevant_communication:
Conferences 
 
Meeting “European Open Space to analyze, strategize, and (re)claim rights of female Refugees and Migrants”, that was held on 14 November in Brussels. Belgium in 2016, report: https://wideplus.org/2016/11/09/european-strategy-and-advocacy-workshop-with-refugee-and-migrant-women/. 
 
A significant action for 2016 was the organizing of the international conference “Movements, Borders, Rights? Feminist Perspectives on Global issues in Europe” that took place in Brussels, Belgium, at 24 and 25 October, 2016. WIDE+ + EWL, and in cooperation with Heinrich Böll Foundation (HBF), Friedrich Ebert Stiftung (FES) and Rosa Luxemburg Foundation (RLS): https://wideplus.org/2016/11/01/final-conference-statement-is-available/.  
 
Other activites 
*Annual WIDE+ members delegation during UN CSW 
*WIDE+ supports CSO statements, campaigns and positions itself publicly 
*WIDE+ has been publishing regularly its newsletter to its 2000 subscribers News and information relevant for women’s rights advocates are also shared among through email lists, its website (wideplus.org), facebook site (https://www.facebook.com/WIDEfeministnetwork/) and twitter. 
*WIDE+ provides feminist recommendations and analysis during public spaces, such as Women’s Rights spaces, and policy or public spaces. Among others: 
*Feminist Economic Literacy toolkit: https://wideplus.org/2015/08/10/ 
publication-with-tools-on-enhancing-economic-literacy-by-wide-members/ 
*2015 WIDE+ Conference develops proposals for a new women’s rights paradigm: http://wp.me/p2KSLS-hT. 
 
Influencing European decision makers actors to promote women's rights  
 
WIDE+ is an active member to the Working Group of the Women’s Major Group (WMG) for development that has jointly advocated in Post-2015 Development Agenda’s. And WIDE+ is the European coordinator of the feminist Constituency in CPDE (Global Civil Society Coordination Group around post Aid Effectiveness Agenda). https://wideplus.org/feminist-constituency-call-for-a-stronger-implementation-of-womens-rights-in-global-partnership-in-development/ 
 
The WIDE+ Gender and Trade Working Group prepared a position paper in 2017 with key recommendations for advocating a feminist trade policy towards European decision makers. https://wideplusnetwork.files.wordpress.com/2017/06/eu_trade_gender_policy_wide_final.pdf
